sub_title: architect + owner at M+R interior architecture
summary:
POSITIVE ENVIRONMENTALISM
The importance of technology, sustainability, innovation and economic development.

M+R interior architecture is a international design office founded by Hans Maréchal. Our fields of activity often involve complex assignments such as converting and designing offices, restaurants, hotels and shops. Among our design skills and core activities for building and exhibition architecture we are also involved with revitalising existing buildings and monuments in particular. The architects from M+R determine the form and content of each design assignment on the basis of the programme of requirements. 
Creativity, functionality, sustainability and ergonomics are translated in a well thought-out manner into a unique final product with an identity of its own. The starting-point is usually a conceptual approach to the design task, for which a total plan is developed, with a sharp eye for details. 
The power of a strong design is vision, innovation and the quality of realisation.

‘Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere’

We attach a lot of value to the integration of technology and its possibilities. Light architecture is also a speciality within the firm, seeing as light in particular makes an important contribution to the quality of life ●

Specialties: SUSTAINABLE INNOVATIVE ARCHITECTURE | INTERIORS

awards.title: A'Design Silver Award winner 2019 | interior architecture Rublev Lounge
awards.description:
Interior architecture Rublev Lounge | Sheremetyevo Airport Moscow

The design of the lounge is inspired by Russian constructivism and Russian culture. The onion-shaped towers are used as eye-catchers in the lounge to create different spaces in the lounge area as a certain kind of zoning. Because of the round domes, the lounge is a comfortable area with different zones for a total capacity of 460 seats. The area has different kind of seating, for dining, working and comfort. The round light domes positioned on the wavy ceiling provide dynamic lighting.

Das Design der Lounge ist vom Konstruktivismus und der russischen Kultur inspiriert. Die typischen Zwiebeltür- me werden als Blickfang in der Lounge verwendet und schaffen eine übersichtliche Einteilung der verschiedenen Loungebereiche. Die Lounge verfügt über eine Gesamtkapazität von 460 Sitzplätzen. Durch die großen Kuppeln werden Bereiche wie Essen, Arbeiten und Entspannen har- monisch und komfortabel präsentiert. Die beleuchteten Kuppeln integrieren sich perfekt in die dynamisch wellenartige Deckenkonstruktion.

projects.title: Revitalization and Office innovation for Koopmans Enschede
projects.description:
Koopmans, Construction & Development Company, Enschede                                                                                            
Office revitalization and innovation by M + R
 
In the renewed office are housed the two locations of Koopmans: Apeldoorn and Enschede. In order to achieve this, there is chosen for a flexible working environment; an open structure with flexible workplaces. These are divided into three domains on the three floorlevels. Because of this choice for a flexible work environment the entire program is realized within the available square meters and, so saves Koopmans on the accommodation costs.
 
The existing office building with a traditional office format and a central corridor area has become a total metamorphosis.  The Office is on the inside completely stripped; for the realization of a pleasant working environment, the lighting, acoustics and climate has to be optimum; There are new acoustic ceilings, there is a sustainable lighting plan with daylight control and the cooling and heating by means of ceiling induction units is settled. As floor covering is chosen for a special carpet; This one has a good feature for absorbing ' fine dust ' and reduces noise.

projects.title: BDO Den Haag
projects.description:
Meeting, sharing knowledge and working innovatively are central to the new housing of 
BDO The Hague

Client: BDO Accountants | the Hague
Assignment: New BDO housing in The Hague

The new office location for BDO The Hague In the HNK building complex is delivered on the first of September. This building complex consists of three office towers that are connected by a floor. Three separate entrance units and parking spaces are located under this floor.
M+R has developed a completely new office concept in close collaboration with the stakeholders and users of BDO. The building concept took shape in the various inspiration and co-creation sessions initiated by M+R on behalf of BDO. The first floor of the building is a large open space where the reception, meeting rooms and the work, eat and meet restaurant are housed. An important part of the concept is the large staircase annex seating tribune that is placed in the middle of the floorspace with which the upper office floors are connected. This tribune is also the place for presentations to large groups of people. This is a large opening between the 1st and 2nd floors therefor is a new steel construction designed. 
The meeting rooms are equipped with "state of the art" audiovisual resources that contribute to the new way of working. In addition to the meeting rooms, this floor will have various different places for consultation, all in a healthy green environment with lots of plants.

The work floors are set up with the work concept of M+R, specially developed for BDO; a meandering landscape with working areas; collaborative spaces; quiet areas, meeting areas, etc. 
A proven concept that has already been successfully rolled out (and copied) in several places. Sustainability is always central at M+R projects, for this project sustainable (bio based and C2C) products are applied and parts of the existing furniture are reused.

courses.name: interior architecture - NL national architects registration

profile_positions.description:
M+R interior architecture
While our volatile consumer society is mainly about buying stuff and keeping up with the latest trends, M+R interior architecture pleads for sustainable interiors that still have the wow factor after twenty years. Volatile designs that quickly get you tired are not for us.

Durability
M+R interior architecture creates interiors for public spaces such as theaters, airports, libraries and innovative work environments. Some of them date back to when M+R was just founded, more then twentytwo years ago. Quality and sustainability are returning themes in all our designs. We use high-quality, sustainable materials that we use in a circular manner. We want to prevent the customer from becoming restless and wanting to change after a few years. Volatility should never be the basis. The office projects we design should still feel like home after years. Important factors in this are atmosphere, climate, acoustics and ergonomics.

Internal and external: one story
If our team starts a new project, we will start a conversation with as many future "residents" as possible. Before we make a design, we would like to hear all wishes, requirements and information from both stakeholders and users. Like what is the environment in which they feel most at home? This, together with the environment, forms the basis for the design. We have extensive experience with characteristic, often monumental buildings. We always first enter into a relationship with the building and its surroundings. An interior must match and respond to the outside. Internal and external must tell one story.
profile_positions.title: architect + owner

profile_positions.description: M+R interior architecture is specialized in designing projects for the utility market; this concerns new buildings as well as renovation of existing buildings and restoration of monumental buildings, particularly public buildings. Our architects determine the form and content of each design assignment into an optimal synergy between the organization and the accommodation, innovative and sustainable.
